talk.author: did:plc:2knwm7g3qy275mcvy2kiuagj
talk.utter: That is some bad poetry there.

talk.author: did:plc:5wwn3plq6rdcfrq6ka6skquf
talk.utter: Crazy shit like this is my favorite way to use ChatGPT. $700,000 per day well spent, I say.

talk.author: did:plc:2knwm7g3qy275mcvy2kiuagj
talk.utter: Oh, a computer wrote that? No wonder it has no idea what "meter" is and thinks AAAA BBBB CCCC DDDD is an aesthetically-pleasing rhyme scheme.

talk.author: did:plc:2knwm7g3qy275mcvy2kiuagj
talk.utter: Now I'm curious to see what the program would spit out if asked to write an essay in the style of Maggie McNeill.

talk.author: did:plc:2knwm7g3qy275mcvy2kiuagj
talk.utter: Holy shit, this is actually not that bad!

talk.author: did:plc:5wwn3plq6rdcfrq6ka6skquf
talk.utter: That’s what I thought. This sort of mimicry plays to its strengths. It sounds a bit like you, and it certainly hits a lot of your concerns, although the whole piece doesn’t quite hang together.

talk.author: did:plc:2knwm7g3qy275mcvy2kiuagj
talk.utter:
Right, it's more like a series of talking points than  cohesive essay, and it uses a couple of "activese" phrases I'd never use, though many others do. And of course it lacks my style, verve and panache.  But it's not pure gobbledygook. 

To sum up, I'll quote Dr. Johnson's comment on...

talk.author: did:plc:2knwm7g3qy275mcvy2kiuagj
talk.utter: ...female preachers: "Sir, a woman's preaching is like a dog's walking on his hind legs. It is not done well; but you are surprised to find it done at all."
